lines.gurmukhi: pwqr mY jYsy bhu ibMjn prosIAq Bojn kY fwrIAq pwvY nwih Twm ko
lines.transliteration_english: Paatar Mai Jaisay Bahu Binjan Paroseeata , Bhojan Kai Daareeat Paavai Naahi Tthaam Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as several eatables are served in a big leaf but after eating these dishes, the leaf is thrown away. Then it has no place in one's scheme of things.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy hI qmol rs rsnw rswie Kwie fwrIAY augwr nwih rhY AwF dwm ko
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Hee Tamol Ras Rasanaa Rasaai Khaai , Daareeai Ougaar Naahi Rahai Aaddh Daam Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as betel leaf extract is obtained by masticating the leaf and after enjoying the extract, the residue is thrown away. It is not worth even half a shell.

lines.gurmukhi: PUln ko hwr aur Dwr bws lIjY jYsy pwCY fwr dIjY khY hY n kwhU kwm ko
lines.transliteration_english: Dhoolan Ko Haar Ur Dhaar Baas Leejai Jaisay , Paachhai Daar Deejai Kahai Hai N Kaahoo Kaam Ko ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a garland of flowers is worn around the neck and sweet smell of the flowers is enjoyed, but once these flowers wither away, these are thrown away saying that they are no good now.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy kys nK Qwn BiRst n suhwq kwhU piRX ibCurq soeI sUq BXo bwm ko ]615]
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Kays Nakh Daan Bhrisat N Suhaat Kaahoo , Priy Bichhurat Soee Soot Bhayo Baam Ko ?615?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as hair and nails if plucked from their actual place are very uncomfortable and painful, such is the state of a woman separated from love of her husband.  (615)
